intro: Horkeliella purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered horkeliella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a distinct, spicy scent. Horkeliella purpurascens is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates.
